text: Roger Olsson (born 30 January 1944) is a Swedish former ice hockey center and Olympian. Olsson played with Team Sweden at the 1968 Winter Olympics held in Grenoble, France.https://www.hockey-reference.com/olympics/athletes/svante- granholm-1 He previously played for VIK Västerås HK and Frölunda HC in the Swedish Elite League.Society for International Hockey Research Database, retrieved June 29, 2015 ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Ice hockey players at the 1968 Winter Olympics Category:Living people Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Sweden Category:Swedish ice hockey centres
title: Roger Olsson
